templates.template: Oracle Cloud Boot Volume by HTTP
templates.name: Oracle Cloud Boot Volume by HTTP
templates.description:
Monitor Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) boot volume.

This template is not meant to be used independently, but instead with Oracle Cloud by HTTP as a template for
LLD host prototypes.

Read the template documentation prior to using this template.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Volume guaranteed IOPS
items.description: Rate of change for guaranteed IOPS per SLA. Expressed as the average of guaranteed IOPS during a given time interval.

items.name: Get metrics
Volume read throughput
items.description: Read throughput. Expressed as bytes read per interval.

items.name: Volume read operations
items.description: Activity level from I/O reads. Expressed as reads per interval.

items.name: State

triggers.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Boot Volume by HTTP/oci.boot.volume.state,5m) = 0
triggers.name: Boot volume state unknown

dependencies.name: Boot volume terminated or faulty
dependencies.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Boot Volume by HTTP/oci.boot.volume.state,5m) >= 4

triggers.expression: min(/Oracle Cloud Boot Volume by HTTP/oci.boot.volume.state,5m) >= 4
triggers.name: Boot volume terminated or faulty

items.name: Volume throttled operations
items.description: Total sum of all the I/O operations that were throttled during a given time interval.

items.name: Volume guaranteed throughput
items.description: Rate of change for guaranteed throughput per SLA. Expressed as megabytes per interval.

items.name: Volume guaranteed VPUs/GB
items.description: Rate of change for currently active VPUs/GB. Expressed as the average of active VPUs/GB during a given time interval.

items.name: Volume write throughput
items.description: Write throughput. Expressed as bytes read per interval.

items.name: Volume write operations
items.description: Activity level from I/O writes. Expressed as writes per interval.

macros.description: Set an HTTP proxy for OCI API requests if needed.
Set the HTTP return code that represents an OK response from the API. The default is "200",  but can vary, for example, if a proxy is used.
